page.title: 06St.Margaret's Church Isfield
page.content: The Church was built in 1204 and was {restored}in 1876 when the top part of the tower was added. After the 1939-45 War a stained glass{Benidicite Window was built in the Shurley Chapel. It was closed in 1983 owing to the danger of falling masonry. Fund raising is an important activity. A plant sale and a 'car wash' morning have been held. The Curate takes two{services}each } week. There is an 8am Service but only six people come. Every First Sunday there is a 10am{Family Service}which is well attended. A special Pets Ser- ice has been held in recent years. On the Second and Fourth Sundays there is an 11am{1662 Matins}Communion Service. About 35 people attend each. A{Sunday {School}is held at the Village Hall. There are about five regular members. Children's parties are organised for fun.
